user_account.min_8: Minimum 12 characters and maximum 128 characters with at least two of 1) lower case, 2) upper case, 3) digits and 4) special characters. 5) Password cannot be same as username

user_account.pwdstrinvalid: Password is too short or contains space

user_account.alert_8: Confirm To Empty All Users? This Is A Irreversible Action - Deleted Users Will Be Permanently Removed From The System!

user_account.retrieveAccessRights_msg2: System Error -- The Access Rights Of The User Role Not Found

user_account.invalid_mno: Numbers Only. Please Enter The Mobile Number In The International Format
user_account.invalid_username: Sorry, Username must be minimum 8 characters, maximum 15 characters and only contains alphabet and number.
user_account.invalid_new_password: Sorry, Password must be at least 12 characters long and meet password complexity requirements.
user_account.invalid_confirmpwd: The 2 Passwords Entered Do Not Match! Please Check Again
user_account.invalid_mobile_numb: Sorry, Mobile Number must be in the international format start with a plus sign (+) followed by country code and number.
user_account.invalid_email: Please provide a valid email address.
user_account.invalid_access_start: Sorry, Access Start Date cannot be later than Access End Date.
user_account.invalid_access_end: Sorry, Access End Date cannot be earlier than Access Start Date.
user_account.invalid_session_timeout: Please provide a valid session timeout in minute.
user_account.invalid_pwd_threshold: Please provide a valid lockout threshold in number of attempt.
user_account.invalid_pwd_expire: Please provide a valid password expiry in day.
user_account.invalid_date: Please priovide a valid date format.

add_keyword.title: Add Portal Keyword
add_keyword.keyword_desc: Keyword is the first word of the SMS message. The system will route the incoming SMS based on the keyword specified. Keyword 'EM' is a reserved keyword. Keyword 'xDEFAULTx' is a default keyword.(maximum 15 characters)
add_keyword.email_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to these E-mail addresses. Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.redirect_mno_desc: A copy of the incoming SMS will be forwarded to this mobile number. Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.xml_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP + POX method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.soap_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post with SOAP method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.json_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post with JSON method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
add_keyword.auto_msg_desc: Please select to enable autoreply message to the sender.
add_keyword.email_brochure_desc: Email brochure feature allows the server to send an email automatically to the SMS sender if the email address is specified. Please select to activate the service.
add_keyword.reply_email_address_desc: This will be the Reply-To email address for the auto-email feature when sending the email brochure to the user.
add_keyword.email_subject_desc: This refers to the subject matter in the email when it is being sent to the user.
add_keyword.email_content_desc: This is the introductory message for the email when it is being sent to the user.
add_keyword.file_upload_desc: Please select the file to be attached to the email. Please upload the file to the server.
add_keyword.alert_3: Autoreply Message Maximum Length Is 160 Characters!
add_keyword.alert_4: This Keyword Already Exists In The System!
add_keyword.alert_5: Sorry, you are over the limit of 160 characters
add_keyword.senderchklst_desc1: This is to limit the service to the listed Mobile numbers only.
add_keyword.senderchklst_desc2: Enter each mobile number in a new line.
add_keyword.senderchklst_desc3: All mobile numbers must be set in international mobile format.
add_keyword.modem_imei_desc: This will set the system to match the keyword to a specific modem only.\nEnter each IMEI number in a new line.
add_keyword.invalid_keyword: Please provide a valid keyword (contains letters, numbers, or '-').
add_keyword.invalid_description: Sorry, you are over the limit of 100 characters.
add_keyword.invalid_message: Sorry, you are over the limit of 160 characters.

edit_keyword.title: Edit Portal Keyword
edit_keyword.keyword_desc: Keyword is the first word of the SMS message. The system will route the incoming SMS based on the keyword specified. Keyword 'EM' is a reserved keyword. Keyword 'xDEFAULTx' is a default keyword.(maximum 15 characters)
edit_keyword.email_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to these E-mail addresses. Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.redirect_mno_desc: A copy of the incoming SMS will be forwarded to this mobile number. Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.xml_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP + POX method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.soap_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post with SOAP method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.json_url_desc: The system will route the messages (based on the keyword) to this URL (via HTTP Post with JSON method). Set to 'NA' to disable it.
edit_keyword.auto_msg_desc: Please select to enable autoreply message to the sender.
edit_keyword.email_brochure_desc: Email brochure feature allows the server to send an email automatically to the SMS sender if the email address is specified. Please select to activate the service.
edit_keyword.reply_email_address_desc: This will be the Reply-To email address for the auto-email feature when sending the email brochure to the user.
edit_keyword.email_subject_desc: This refers to the subject matter in the email when it is being sent to the user.
edit_keyword.email_content_desc: This is the introductory message for the email when it is being sent to the user.
edit_keyword.file_upload_desc: Please select the file to be attached to the email. Please upload the file to the server.
edit_keyword.file_upload_note: NOTE: The new uploaded file will overwrite the current file.
edit_keyword.alert_1: System Error - Keyword ID Not Set!
edit_keyword.alert_2: Autoreply Message Maximum Length Is 160 Characters!
edit_keyword.senderchklst_desc1: This is to limit the service to the listed Mobile numbers only.
edit_keyword.senderchklst_desc2: Enter each mobile number in a new line.
edit_keyword.senderchklst_desc3: All mobile numbers must be set in international mobile format.
edit_keyword.modem_imei_desc: This will set the system to match the keyword to a specific modem only.\nEnter each IMEI number in a new line.
edit_keyword.invalid_keyword: Please provide a valid keyword (contains letters, numbers, or '-').
edit_keyword.invalid_description: Sorry, you are over the limit of 100 characters.
edit_keyword.invalid_message: Sorry, you are over the limit of 160 characters.

campaign_rdb.mail_merge_tmpl_desc:
Use variable <data_[column_number]> to replace the column value retrieved from SQL Profile. For example:
select mobile,name,message from reminder_table

<data_1> = Value in 'name' column
<data_2> = Value in 'message' column

** Please note that <data_0> is reserved for mobile number to receive SMS
campaign_rdb.in_exp_days_dtl: This configuration will be used for keyword matching.
campaign_rdb.sql_query_dtl:
Use the special variable xxDatexx to replace with the advance day to pull the record. Example:
select patient_name,patient_mobile from patient_record where appt_date = xxDatexx
campaign_rdb.db_conf_id_desc: Unique ID of Database Configuration. If this is a MSSQL Configuration, this name will be used when establishing connection.
campaign_rdb.rdb_port_desc: Default port: Oracle: 1521 | MSSQL: 1433 | PostgreSQL: 5432 | MySQL: 3306
campaign_rdb.rdb_target_db_desc:
Database to be used.
- MSSQL - Leave blank if default database to be used.
- Oracle - Set to the database that is tied to the SID given.
campaign_rdb.reply_query_desc:
These messages are applicable if the keyword is set to retrieve information from any Database (as set in SQL Query String). If there is any matched record found, the Matched message will be returned; otherwise the Unmatched will be sent back. Mail-merged feature is applicable to both messages.

To enable mail-merge reply message, that is based on the SQL query (xxFIELD_xx), simply define the following variable in the message.

Eg. Hi xxFIELD_1xx, your score is xxFIELD_3xx
campaign_rdb.resp_query_desc_1: This is the Database to connect and retrieve the result with the specified SQL query in the text box. The system will then merge the SMS content into the query condition if specified.
campaign_rdb.resp_query_desc_2:
SMS Query Condition: Eg. me myid myanswer
  • me - This is the keyword (index 0)
  • myid - This is the FIRST content (index 1)
  • myanswer - This is the SECOND content (index 2)
To select a record based on the id, the SQL query should be set as following:
Select score from mytable where id='xxFIELD_1xx';

To update the answer with user mobile number and received date(yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss), the SQL query should be as following:
Update mytable set answer='xxFIELD_2xx', mobile_number='xxMOBILExx', received_date='xxRECEIVED_DATExx' where id='xxFIELD_1xx';
campaign_rdb.keyword_target_db_desc:
The target database is different from the default database of the selected host.
Only applicable to MSSQL only.

maintenance_report.descr1: The system will keep the Conversation history according to the duration set here. Set to '0' day will keep the history indefinitely in the system.
maintenance_report.descr2: Conversation usage report will contain the report for Conversation history. Available options:
maintenance_report.descr3: Disable: This will disable the usage report.
maintenance_report.descr4: Daily: The report will be generated daily.
maintenance_report.descr5: Weekly: The report will be generated every Monday.
maintenance_report.descr6: Monthly: The report will be generated every 1st day of the month.
maintenance_report.descr7: This set the Email address that will receive the Conversation Usage Report.
